title: Republican Senator Announces She Will Vote Against Trump’s EPA Pick
text:

“His actions leave me with considerable doubts about whether his vision for the EPA is consistent with the agency’s critical mission to protect human health and the environment,” Collins told Maine Public Radio . 
In her announcement, the senator cited concerns about air pollution as one of the primary reasons for her decision. 
“The state of Maine, located at the end of our nation’s ‘air pollution tailpipe,’ is on the receiving end of pollution generated by coal-fired power plants in other states. Reducing harmful air pollutants is critical for public health, particularly for Maine which has among the highest rates of asthma in the country,” she said. Advertisement - story continues below 
As Oklahoma’s attorney general, Pruitt sued the EPA 14 times to block regulations imposed by the Obama administration. 
Collins cited Pruitt’s past actions as one of the reasons she wouldn’t support him to head up the EPA. 
“I have significant concerns that Mr. Pruitt has actively opposed and sued the EPA on numerous issues that are of great importance to the state of Maine, including mercury controls for coal-fired power plants and efforts to reduce cross-state air pollution and greenhouse gas emissions,” Collins said. 
She did note that Pruitt was an “an accomplished attorney with considerable knowledge about environmental laws,” and if he were nominated for any other position, Collins said she would probably support him. Advertisement - story continues below
